Dan Goodman
posts.content:
It is time to change the employee landscape. 

It has been too one-sided for too long. Pretty much every aspect of the employee/employer relationship.

Employers have all the leverage, yet without employees, employers have no company. Individually we have very little power, collectively we have a lot. I’m not talking unions. I’m talking about companywide revolts.

How about if a leader invokes a predatory windfall clause on a salesperson or changes the compensation plan retroactively, then every salesperson on the team stops selling in protest or they collectively take their concerns to the CEO.

If not, who is to say that you’re not next. The employer has little choice but to do the right thing, at least in the short term.

All for one, one for all.
posts.commentAdded: Absolutely agree! Collective action can empower employees to reshape the workplace. Its time for mutual respect in the employer-employee dynamic!
